question: What is Azure Blob Storage?
What are the three types of blobs in Azure Blob Storage?
Which type of blob in Azure Blob Storage is optimized for append operations?
What is the maximum size of a block blob in Azure Blob Storage?
Which storage access tier in Azure Blob Storage is suitable for frequently accessed data?
What is the purpose of a Shared Access Signature (SAS) in Azure Blob Storage?

answers.text: To provide temporary access to resources

question: Which Azure service can be used to trigger events based on blob storage activity?
What is the purpose of the 'immutable storage' feature in Azure Blob Storage?

answers.text: To prevent the creation of new containers
To prevent modification or deletion of data for a specified retention interval
To limit the number of blobs in a storage account
To restrict access to specific IP addresses

question: Which Azure Blob Storage feature allows you to automatically replicate data to another Azure region?
What is the purpose of the 'soft delete' feature in Azure Blob Storage?

answers.text: To recover deleted blobs within a retention period
To replicate data to another region

question: Which Azure Blob Storage feature allows you to configure automatic versioning of blobs?
What is the purpose of the 'soft delete' feature in Azure Blob Storage?

answers.text: To recover deleted blobs within a retention period
To replicate data to another region

question: Which Azure Blob Storage feature allows you to configure automatic versioning of blobs?
Which Azure Blob Storage feature allows you to index the content of your blobs to perform full-text searches?
How can you optimize blob storage costs in Azure?

answers.text: By using the 'Archive' access tier for infrequently accessed data
By using the 'Hot' access tier for all blobs
By disabling versioning for all blobs
By enabling soft delete for all blobs

question: What is the purpose of Azure Blob Storage Lifecycle Management?

answers.text: To automatically transition blobs between access tiers

question: Which Azure Blob Storage feature allows you to configure a rule to automatically delete blobs that match specific criteria?
What is the purpose of the 'Blob Indexer' feature in Azure Blob Storage?

answers.text: To automatically delete blobs that match specific criteria
To configure automatic versioning of blobs
To index the content of your blobs for full-text searches
To replicate data to another region

question: Which Azure Blob Storage feature allows you to create read-only snapshots of a blob's state at a specific point in time?
How can you secure access to blobs in Azure Blob Storage?

answers.text: By using a Shared Access Signature (SAS)
By enabling versioning for all blobs
By disabling soft delete for all blobs

question: What is the purpose of Azure Blob Storage Static Website feature?

answers.text: To host static content and serve HTML, CSS, and JavaScript files
